bill_title: revise certain provisions regarding pensions allowed firefighters for impairment caused by cancer.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to revise certain provisions regarding pensions allowed firefighters for impairment caused by cancer. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 9-16-3.3 be amended to read as follows: 9-16-3.3. A pension may shall be allowed pursuant to § 9-16-3.2 for any condition of impairment of health caused by primary brain cancer, malignant melanoma, leukemia, multiple myeloma, non-Hodgkin's lymphoma, bladder cancer, ureter cancer, and kidney cancer resulting in total or partial disability to an officer or member of a fire department who, upon entering such service or after employment , successfully passed a physical examination which failed to reveal any evidence of such condition. This section pertains solely to pension matters under this chapter and does not restrict a claimant's ability to file for benefits under chapter 62-8 or change the burden of proof established in § 62-8-12. Any total disability allowance provided by this section shall be equal to seventy-five percent of the highest annual compensation earned in any of the previous three years immediately preceding the date of the disability, this compensation shall be increased by ten percent for each child to a maximum of four children, to a maximum of one hundred percent of highest annual compensation.

FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to revise certain provisions regarding pensions allowed firefighters for impairment caused by cancer. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 9-16-3.3 be amended to read as follows: 9-16-3.3. A pension may shall be allowed pursuant to § 9-16-3.2 for any condition of impairment of health caused by primary brain cancer, malignant melanoma, leukemia, multiple myeloma, non-Hodgkin's lymphoma, bladder cancer, ureter cancer, and kidney cancer resulting in total or partial disability to an officer or member of a fire department who has served at least five years, and who, upon entering such service or after employment , successfully passed a physical examination which failed to reveal any evidence of such condition. This section pertains solely to pension matters under this chapter and does not restrict a claimant's ability to file for benefits under chapter 62-8 or change the burden of proof established in § 62-8-12. Any total disability allowance provided by this section shall be equal to seventy-five percent of the highest annual compensation earned in any of the previous three years immediately preceding the date of the disability. 350 copies of this document were printed by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.027 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.
